original_title: Sri Lanka stocks close up, turnover at Rs1.9bn
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – The Colombo Stock Exchange closed up on Friday, data on its site showed.
The broader All Share Index closed up 0.18 percent, or 22.62 points, at 12,313; while the more liquid S&P SL20 Index closed up 0.26 percent, or 9.41 points, at 3,622.
Turnover was 1.9 billion. The diversified financials sector brought in Rs648mn, while the food, beverage and tobacco counters brought in Rs346mn.
“With the vehicle import ban likely to be reversed, there has been renewed local investor interest in leasing and finance companies,” Softlogic stockbrokers said.
“There is expectation that growth will continue in non-banking finance institutions.”
Crossings were recorded in Dialog Axiata (up at 10.90), LB Finance (up at 73.50), and Janashakthi Insurance (up at 42.70).
“The crossing on LB Finance followed its positive results for 2Q FY2024, with earnings up by over 8 percent.”

Top contributors to the ASPI were C T Holdings (up at 299.00), Central Finance (up at 122.50), Hatton National Bank (up at 214.50), John Keells Holdings (up at 197.00), and Citizens Business Development (up at 215.00).

Top foreign selling was seen in Sampath Bank (down at 81.60), First Capital Holdings (down at 31.50), Lankem Developments (up at 20.40), Commercial Bank (up at 108.50), Chevron Lubricants (up at 126.50), and ACL Cables (up at 88.00).

Top foreign selling was seen in Dialog, Balangoda Plantations (up at 58.50), Digital Mobility Solutions (up at 43.90), Union Assurance (up at 52.00), Vallibel Finance (up at 45.00), and LB Finance. (Colombo/Oct18/2024)
